channel.title: Classic Half-Life sound pack
channel.description:
Black Mesa is great. Quite a few times throughout the game I felt like I was playing the original Half-Life, but renovated. Shooting is enjoyable, music is OK, level design is amazing - it is very much close to Half-Life. The only problem for me were the sound effects. The developers made a huge effort to mimic the classic sounds and they did okay, but it's just not the originals we all love. Because of that I decided to create a little modification consisting my favorite sound effects from the original Half-Life. These include:
[b]Weapons:[/SIZE][/b]
* Tau Cannon * Gluon Gun * Snark hunt and deploy sounds
[b]UI:[/SIZE][/b]
* Ammo pickup * Weapon pickup * Flashlight on/off (Half-Life 2) * Health charger * Suit charger * Medkit pickup
[b]NPC:[/SIZE][/b]
* Houndeye charging and hurting sounds
Notes: 1.) If you think HL's Tau Cannon overcharge sounds are lame, you can always replace them with the BM's (included in the pack) 2.) I didn't replace the battery pickup sound because it's a bleak Counter-Strike weapon pickup sound. But in case you are an ultra-purist I included it in the pack
Here's a video preview [url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yfm_snCzGX8[/url]

item.title: Classic Half-Life sound pack
item.dc:creator: xalener
item.description:
Added those freckles (they were supposed to be pits, but the texture was so low rez in HL1 it always registered to me as splotches of darker pigment) and some of the hexagonal turtle shell shit to the belly that the original had. I changed the diffuse of the shackles back to the original HL2 ones because the iridescence map kinda took care of the green tint it needed anyway. I could whip up something higher rez though, definitely. Also, simplified the pupil detail greatly to match the flat red that was in HL1. That affected the bullsquid too, but meh. I think it looks cooler on the BS anyway. Though I do wish it had that white eye it did in the original. Maybe I can do something about that, but I doubt it.

I also added a separate lightrap texture for the vorts and the Agrunts for more exaggerated translucency. I’m testing out something else for the bullsquids and houndeyes since an orange endodermis layer doesn’t make much sense for them.

Anyway, I don’t want to derail this thread. I’ll start my own when I get home. I was weary about it because the rules said “NO SOUNDS”. It really sucks, because that’s my specialty.

item.title: Classic Half-Life sound pack
item.dc:creator: brokenfridgehinge
item.description:
HEVcrab:

I would have included the Alien Slaves’ (Vortigaunts’) classical sounds, they are really evil, sinister and alien battle commands and curses. The currently present HL2EP2-style sounds are quite confusing: the vorts are enemies to human beings and slaves of Nihilanth but speak the same lamm-dalalamm like friendly HL2 Vorts with the same rather human tone of the voice…

I agree about the Vorts, but I guess they kept the same sounds from HL2 and the episodes for consistency. I do prefer the harsh cackling of the Vorts from HL1 though, they just feel more ‘alien’.
